<line: 10> Case Number: EP:16-CR-00620-KC(1)
<line: 11> USM Number: 69100-380

[TEXT]
<line: 13> v.

[TITLE]
<line: 15> MARTIN MACHADO-FLORES

[TEXT]
<line: 17> Defendant.

[TITLE]
<line: 19> JUDGMENT IN A CRIMINAL CASE
<line: 20> (For Offenses Committed On or After November 1, 1987)

[TEXT]
<line: 22> The defendant, MARTIN MACHADO-FLORES, was represented by Erik Anthony Hanshew and Shane Michael McMahon..

[TEXT]
<line: 24> The defendant pled guilty to Count(s) One of the Indictment on May 12, 2016. Accordingly, the defendant is adjudged guilty of
<line: 25> such Count(s), involving the following offense(s):

[TITLE]
<line: 27> Title & Section / Nature of Offense

[TEXT]
<line: 29> Offense Ended

[TEXT]
<line: 31> 8 U.S.C. 1326(a) -- Illegal Re-Entry

[TEXT]
<line: 33> March 16, 2016

[TEXT]
<line: 35> As pronounced on May 12, 2016, the defendant is sentenced as provided in pages 2 through 4 of this Judgment. The sentence is.
<line: 36> imposed pursuant to the Sentencing Reform Act of 1984.

[TEXT]
<line: 38> It is further ordered that the defendant shall notify the United States Attorney for this district within 30 days of any change of name,
<line: 39> residence, or mailing address until all fines, restitution, costs, and special assessments imposed by this Judgment are fully paid. If ordered to
<line: 40> pay restitution, the defendant shall notify the Court and United States Attorney of any material change in the defendant's economic
<line: 41> circumstances.

[TEXT]
<line: 43> SIGNED this 12th day of May, 2016.

[ABANDON]
<line: 45> KATALEEN CARDONE
<line: 46> UN
<line: 47> TED STATES DISTRIC
<line: 48> UDGE

[TITLE]
<line: 2> Case 3:16-cr-00620-KC   Document 22   Filed 05/12/16   Page 2 of 4

[TEXT]
<line: 4> AO 245B (Rev. TXW 9/15) Judgment in a Criminal Case 

[ABANDON]
<line: 6> Judgment -- Page 2 of 4 

[TEXT]
<line: 8> DEFENDANT:  
<line: 9> MARTIN MACHADO-FLORES 
<line: 10> CASE NUMBER:  
<line: 11> 3:16-CR-00620-KC(1) 

[TITLE]
<line: 13> PROBATION 

[TEXT]
<line: 15> The defendant is hereby placed on non-reporting probation for a term of five (5) years as to count one. 

[TEXT]
<line: 17> While on probation, the defendant shall comply with the mandatory, standard and if applicable, the additional conditions on the 
<line: 18> attached page that have been adopted by this Court. 

[TEXT]
<line: 20> The mandatory drug testing provision of the Violent Crime Control and Law Enforcement Act of 1994 is suspended. 

[TITLE]
<line: 22> Mandatory Conditions: 

[TEXT]
<line: 24> 1) 
<line: 25> The defendant shall not commit another federal, state, or local crime during the term of supervision. 
<line: 26> 2)  
<line: 27> The defendant shall not unlawfully possess a controlled substance. 
<line: 28> 3) 
<line: 29> The defendant shall refrain from any unlawful use of a controlled substance.  The defendant shall submit to one drug test within 15 days of 
<line: 30> release on probation or supervised release and a t least two periodic drug tests thereafter (as determined by the court) for use of a controlled 
<line: 31> substance, but the condition stated in this paragraph may be meliorated or suspended by the court if the defendant’s presentence report or 
<line: 32> other reliable sentencing information indicates low risk of future substance abuse by the defendant.  
<line: 33> 4) 
<line: 34> In supervised release cases only, the defendant must report to the probation office in the district to which the defendant  is released within 
<line: 35> 72 hours of release from custody of the Bureau of Prisons.   
<line: 36> 5) 
<line: 37> The defendant shall not possess a firearm, ammunition, destructive device, or any other dangerous weapon. 
<line: 38> 6) 
<line: 39> The defendant shall cooperate in the collection of DNA as directed by the probation officer, if the collection of such a sample is authorized 
<line: 40> pursuant to section 3 of the DNA Analysis Backlog Elimination Act of 2000 (42 U.S.C. § 14135a). 
<line: 41> ☐ 
<line: 42> If convicted of a sexual offense and required to register under the Sex Offender and Registration Act, that the defendant comply with the 
<line: 43> requirements of the Act. 
<line: 44> ☐ 
<line: 45> If convicted of a domestic violence crime as defined in 18 U.S.C. § 3561(b), the defendant shall participate in an approved program for 
<line: 46> domestic violence. 
<line: 47> ☐ 
<line: 48> If the judgment imposes a fine or restitution, it is a condition of supervision that the defendant pay in accordance with the Schedule of 
<line: 49> Payments sheet of the judgment. 

[TITLE]
<line: 51> Standard Conditions: 

[TEXT]
<line: 53> 1) 
<line: 54> Unless excluded, deported or removed, upon release on probation or supervision, the defendant shall not leave the judicial district without 
<line: 55> permission of the court or probation officer. 
<line: 56> 2) 
<line: 57> If the defendant is excluded, deported, or removed upon release on probation or supervised release, the term of supervision shall be a non-
<line: 58> reporting term of probation or supervised release.  The defendant shall not illegally reenter the United States.  If the defendant lawfully 
<line: 59> reenters the United States during the term of probation or supervised release, the defendant shall immediately report in person to the nearest 
<line: 60> U.S. Probation Office. 

[TITLE]
<line: 2> Case 3:16-cr-00620-KC   Document 22   Filed 05/12/16   Page 3 of 4

[TEXT]
<line: 4> AO 245B (Rev. TXW 9/15) Judgment in a Criminal Case

[TEXT]
<line: 8> DEFENDANT:  
<line: 9> MARTIN MACHADO-FLORES 
<line: 10> CASE NUMBER:  
<line: 11> 3:16-CR-00620-KC(1) 

[TITLE]
<line: 13> ADDITIONAL CONDITIONS OF PROBATION 

[TEXT]
<line: 15> NOT APPLICABLE. 

[TITLE]
<line: 2> Case 3:16-cr-00620-KC   Document 22   Filed 05/12/16   Page 4 of 4

[TEXT]
<line: 4> AO 245B (Rev. TXW 9/15) Judgment in a Criminal Case 

[ABANDON]
<line: 6> Judgment -- Page 4 of 4 

[TEXT]
<line: 8> DEFENDANT:  
<line: 9> MARTIN MACHADO-FLORES 
<line: 10> CASE NUMBER:  
<line: 11> 3:16-CR-00620-KC(1) 

[TITLE]
<line: 13> CRIMINAL MONETARY PENALTIES/ SCHEDULE 

[TEXT]
<line: 15> The defendant shall pay the following total criminal monetary penalties in accordance with the schedule of payments set forth.  
<line: 16> Unless the Court has expressly ordered otherwise, if this judgment imposes imprisonment, payment of criminal monetary penalties is due 
<line: 17> during the period of imprisonment.  Criminal Monetary Penalties, except those payments made through Federal Bureau of Prisons’ Inmate 
<line: 18> Financial Responsibility Program shall be paid through the Clerk, United States District Court, 525 Magoffin Avenue, Room 105, El Paso, 
<line: 19> Texas 79901.  

[TEXT]
<line: 21> The defendant shall receive credit for all payments previously made toward any criminal monetary penalties imposed. 

[TABLE]
<line: 23> Assessment 
<line: 24> Fine 
<line: 25> Restitution 
<line: 26> $.00 
<line: 27> $.00 
<line: 28> $.00 

[TEXT]
<line: 30> TOTAL: 

[TITLE]
<line: 32> Special Assessment 

[TEXT]
<line: 34> Pursuant to 18 U.S.C. § 3573, the Government moves to remit the special assessment.  Therefore, the Court does not impose a 
<line: 35> special assessment. 

[TITLE]
<line: 37> Fine 

[TEXT]
<line: 39> The fine is waived because of the defendant’s inability to pay. 

[TEXT]
<line: 41> If the defendant makes a partial payment, each payee shall receive an approximately proportioned payment, unless specified otherwise in the priority order or 
<line: 42> percentage payment column above. However, pursuant to 18 U.S.C. § 3664(i), all non-federal victims must be paid before the United States is paid. 

[TEXT]
<line: 44> If the fine is not paid, the court may sentence the defendant to any sentence which might have been originally imposed. See 18 U.S.C. §3614. 

[TEXT]
<line: 46> The defendant shall pay interest on any fine or restitution of more than $2,500.00, unless the fine or restitution is paid in full before the fifteenth day after the date of the judgment, 
<line: 47> pursuant to 18 U.S.C. §3612(f). All payment options may be subject to penalties for delinquency and default, pursuant to 18 U.S.C. §3612(g). 

[TEXT]
<line: 49> Payments shall be applied in the following order: (1) assessment, (2) restitution principal, (3) restitution interest, (4) fine principal, (5) community restitution, (6) fine 
<line: 50> interest, (7) penalties, and (8) costs, including cost of prosecution and court costs. 

[TEXT]
<line: 52> Findings for the total amount of losses are required under Chapters 109A, 110, 110A, and 113A of Title 18 for offenses committed on or after September 13, 1994, 
<line: 53> but before April 23, 1996.
